title: Internet Risk Prevention and Digital Competency Strengthening Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone proficiency and internet usage experience
context.additional_context: Project performance for working professionals in mathematics-related fields to analyze and resolve internet risk cases that may occur during work

learning_goals: Participants can identify eight major types of internet risks (e.g., cyberbullying, personal information leaks) and explain prevention strategies.
Participants can design and evaluate risk situation simulation projects using smartphone-based tools.
Participants can write an internet usage habit analysis report and establish improvement plans for addictive behaviors (excessive gaming/gambling/smartphone dependency).
Participants can discover three or more security vulnerabilities in mathematical data processing and propose countermeasures.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
